alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 16 at 3:36PM CDT until March 22 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River near Joslin affecting Whiteside, Henry IL and Rock Island Counties. Rock River at Moline affecting Henry IL and Rock Island Counties. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Rock River at Moline. * WHEN...From late Saturday night to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Water affects some residences in the lower Friendship Farm area. 60th St is under water south of the Green Valley Sports Complex. 56th St along the north side of the river is under water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this evening.
